conversion_verification.notes: Second image is an angled cutaway 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and interior volumes exposed via roof/ceiling removal.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion, readable wall corners and room volumes, isometric-like view, and clean cutaway. Minor simplification of some edge/cap geometry.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches: living/dining left, balcony bottom-left, kitchen top-left with utility adjacent, toilet cluster top-right/center, bedroom bottom-right. Minor proportional differences and the toilet/shaft area appears slightly reinterpreted compared to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present and placed in correct rooms (sofa/table in living, bed in bedroom, kitchen counters/appliances, bathroom fixtures). Scales and orientations generally reasonable.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with distinct walls/floors and good visibility. Some openings (notably windows) are not clearly represented, reducing clarity of facade/opening fidelity.

detected_errors.description: Windows/openings are not clearly shown or do not strongly match the 2D plan locations, making opening verification incomplete.
Bathroom/shaft zone at the top-right appears slightly reconfigured (partitioning/void representation differs from the single toilet layout + adjacent shaft shown in 2D).

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong room layout fidelity, with minor proportional/opening mismatches and a slight reinterpretation of the toilet/shaft area.
